newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Formulab still plans NASDAQ listing.
newsitem.headline: Formulab still plans NASDAQ listing.

text.p: Computer group Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Friday it still plans to list on NASDAQ and that an announcement is expected soon.
On April 9, Formulab said it expected to list on NASDAQ within six weeks.

"It is likely the market is now anticipating an announcement that the listing has been completed. The Company believes that such an announcement will be made imminently," Formulab said in reply to an Australian Stock Exchange query.
The announcement could, however, not be made until NASDAQ had granted final approval, it said.
Formulab launched its neural PC, the Richter Paradigm Computer, in the U.S. in December 1996.
The computer was said to be able to process more complex problems than existing personal computers.
Formulab's share price tumbled shortly after the U.S. launch on media reports of a negative reaction to it. The shares hit a peak around A$1.52 in December about the time of the U.S. launch.
At 11.00 a.m. (0100 GMT), Formulab shares were steady at 28.5 cents.
